posts.post_content: [Lightning bolt](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lightning bolt) has spoiled us. I guess it is good to cycle out lightning bolt. It was in the past two core sets. Posted By: Negated (11/30/2011 1:38:17 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Okay, what I'm about to say may not be popular to many of you guys out there but I just wanted to say that I dislike this card.  
It's because I have started playing magic when Shock was the staple burn card. And when I say staple I mean it. It's a classic card that everyone knows and were actually happy to have in their decks. Everyone was satisfied with it.  
-  
I do understand that with the powercreeping, it became necessary to print this again, to adjust the level of removal and creatures.  
Now that creautres are becoming "normal" again (not too cost efficient), I think it's a good thing that they gave us shock back.  
-  
I can understand people who have started playing with Lightning Bolt being disappointed, but what I'm trying to say is. It's been a GIFT to the players that they've reprinted this card. Shock and its 2 damage variants are fine. Lightning Bolt should NOT be the measuring stick to which we must compare 1 mana burn spells. Shock is.

Posted By: Dabok (7/27/2012 4:35:42 AM)

posts.post_content:
Shock is, in my opinion, similar to [Cancel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cancel).  
Shock is an underpowered [Lightning Bolt](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lightning Bolt), and Cancel is an underpowered [Counterspell](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Counterspell).  
Inbetween the underpowered cards and the overpowered cards, there are plenty of things being thrown in to compensate. (ie. [Galvanic Blast](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Galvanic Blast) and [Stoic Rebuttal](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Stoic Rebuttal).)  
While people are willing to use both Shock and Cancel,  
They are simply at the lower end of the spectrum.
posts.html:

Posted By: nic56 (7/13/2011 8:40:49 PM)

posts.post_content:
Notchism, you shouldn't be playing singular cheap burn in EDH.   
  
Why?  
  
They have 40 life, you can only have 1 of each non-basic-land card, and burn is a quick, aggro strategy. There are very few good aggro strategies in EDH, like Voltron (get lots of Auras/Equipment and attach to your general for quick general damage win).   
  
Lastly, if I were in your situation, I'd play [Curse of the Pierced Heart](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Curse of the Pierced Heart) or something that is a consistent damage dealer for your opponent, and one that you don't have to waste a card draw on. Maybe [Honden of Infinite Rage](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Honden of Infinite Rage), [Magmatic Force](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Magmatic Force) or [Staff of Nin](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Staff of Nin).
posts.html:
Notchism, you shouldn't be playing singular cheap burn in EDH.

Why?

They have 40 life, you can only have 1 of each non-basic-land card, and burn is a quick, aggro strategy. There are very few good aggro strategies in EDH, like Voltron (get lots of Auras/Equipment and attach to your general for quick general damage win).

Lastly, if I were in your situation, I'd play Curse of the Pierced Heart or something that is a consistent damage dealer for your opponent, and one that you don't have to waste a card draw on. Maybe Honden of Infinite Rage, Magmatic Force or Staff of Nin.

posts.post_content:
'Strictly worse than Galvanic Blast. Blast costs the same mana, for the same effect - unless you have metalcraft active, where you get a strictly better effect. I run the blast over shock in any deck that has three or more artifacts.' - Negated  
  
Strictly better/worse is a very hard thing to use, since there are so many card combos turning it around. On first look, your explanation is valid, but its actually invalid.  
  
[Mindslaver](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mindslaver) is used by an opponent. He uses your galvanic blast and kills you sine you were on 4 hp with epic creature defense, playing against a guy whohad no chance but this mindslaver. So, its not STRICLY better, but it is better in high 90's of cases.
posts.html:
'Strictly worse than Galvanic Blast. Blast costs the same mana, for the same effect - unless you have metalcraft active, where you get a strictly better effect. I run the blast over shock in any deck that has three or more artifacts.' - Negated
